definition: oriole or various birds of the Sylvidae family including warblers

sentences.english: I hear the song of the nightingales, and I smell crushed mulberries.
sentences.chinese: 我听见夜莺的歌声，我闻到压碎的桑葚味道。

sentences.english: When the owl sings,the nightingale will hold her peace.
And, dying, it rises above its own agony to outcarol the lark and the nightingale.
sentences.chinese: 它超脱了垂死的剧痛，歌声胜过百灵和夜莺。

sentences.english: Nightingales will not sing in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 关在笼里的夜莺唱不出歌来。

sentences.english: We hear the nightingale at his best.
sentences.chinese: Me们听见夜莺正在尽情地歌唱。

sentences.english: At once nightingale was brought to the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 夜莺很快被带进了宫里见皇帝。

sentences.english: Do you hear the nightingales call?
One nightingale sang at her heart's content: happiness is priceless.
sentences.chinese: 夜莺尽情歌唱着幸福无价。

sentences.english: They say the nightingale pierces his bosom with a thorn when he sings his love song.
sentences.chinese: 他们说夜莺唱出恋歌时，用荆棘刺穿自己的胸膛。

sentences.english: All the songs of the east speak of the love of the nightingale for the rose in the silent starlight night.
sentences.chinese: 东方所有的歌曲都歌诵着夜莺对玫瑰花的爱情。

sentences.english: We nightingales never sing in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 我们夜莺从来不在鸟笼里唱歌。

sentences.english: Dusk is the best time to hear them.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏是听夜莺唱歌的最好时段。

sentences.english: Upon the fulfilment of their revenge they are transformed into a nightingale and a swallow respectively.
sentences.chinese: 实现报复行为后，她们分别变成了夜莺和海燕。
于是夜莺不停地唱下去。

sentences.english: People often confuse robins with nightingales.
sentences.chinese: 人们常常把夜莺跟知更鸟搞混。

sentences.english: So the Nightingale flew over to the Rose-tree that was growing beneath the Student's window.
sentences.chinese: 于是夜莺就朝那棵生长在古日晷器旁的玫瑰树飞去了。

definition: (bird species of China) Eurasian skylark (Alauda arvensis)
umber-black dye for painting the eyebrow
